page.title: 17THE WEY AND ARUN CANAL
page.content: The River Arun was made navigable between 1545 and 1575. This enabled boats to reach Pallingham Quay which is near Pulborough. The Wey Navigation was opened near Guildford in 1673 and was extended to Godalming in 1763. There were proposals to link the two which dated back to 1641. They were opened in 1816. The canal trust was formed in 1970 to preserve and restore the canal. Its objective is to restore the link between the Wey and the Arun. When this is done the water link between the south of England and London will be recreated.
